input_text:
Job Title: Lead Quality Engineer

Location: Omaha Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology, Quality Assurance

Description:
Act as the Lead Quality Engineer within a software development team. Lead the creation of the team’s risk-based quality strategy and drive the application of best available tools and practices within the team. The lead engineer will collaborate with all team roles engaged in creating our web, mobile, desktop, and service (API) delivered product offerings. We are looking for an individual with a collaborative mindset, an inquiring nature, strong critical thinking skills, and the ability to act as a mentor in quality best practices within an agile team. 
RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES: Work closely with dev teams to establish repeatable validation tests and active application monitoring that support a foundation for CI/CD processes and infrastructure.Ability to understand DMSi’s current and evolving architecture. Assist with implementing systems that are highly available, scalable, and resilient.Identify, evaluate, and recommend tools to advance quality capabilities.Assist with defining and developing test automation strategy and framework for testing multiple platforms such as web, mobile, and desktop by incorporating industry best practices.Develop the quality strategy for products. Ensure test coverage is in alignment with the strategy including, but not limited to, automated behavior-driven testing, functional testing, component testing, and performance/load testing.Apply best practices of quality assurance while staying abreast of market trends and technologies.Provide training and mentorship for quality team members to expand knowledge and foster growth.Support speed of product delivery by reducing time for feedback cycles, applying quality tactics to the smallest units of delivery possible, and mentoring team members on appropriate application of quality practices within their roleMaintain an optimized, scalable testing pipeline that is efficient and balances benchmarks with time-to-deployment.Work to continuously improve the speed, efficiency, and scalability of our tests, systems, and environments.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES: Strong knowledge of Quality Assurance methodologies, testing best/emerging practices, automation frameworks, tools, and processes. Strong technical experience with multiple platforms such as web and mobile apps.Ability to configure and manage tool suites.Experience with JavaScript-based User Interfaces and REST APIs preferred.Experience with performance and load testing.Knowledge of SaaS concepts preferred. Knowledge of eCommerce desirable.Knowledge of Java preferred.Knowledge of data strategies for quality and supporting tools (SQL).Detail-oriented, organized, methodical in your approach with strong trouble-shooting skills. Able to prioritize tasks according to importance and severity.Ability to resolve technical and non-technical issues with minimum supervision or assistance.Clear, effective communication skills.Ability to effectively mentor team members and lead initiatives within the area of practice.
WORK ENVIRONMENT & PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Normal office environment with use of computers and telephone systems; no unusual physical demands.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS or related field or 4-7 years of quality engineering experience.Experience in deploying test engineering within CI/CD pipelines.Experience with tools such as: BlazeMeter, Postman, JMeter, JUnit/NUnit, Selenium, Cucumber, Cypress.A strong understanding of SDLC processes.

Experience Level (if available): None

Ability to effectively mentor team members and lead initiatives within the area of practice

Assist with implementing highly available, scalable, and resilient systems
Identify, evaluate, and recommend tools for quality advancement
Define and develop test automation strategy and framework
Apply best practices of quality assurance
Stay abreast of market trends and technologies
Provide training and mentorship for quality team members
Improve speed, efficiency, and scalability of tests, systems, and environments

other.content: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS or related field or 4-7 years of quality engineering experience. Experience in deploying test engineering within CI/CD pipelines. Experience with tools such as: BlazeMeter, Postman, JMeter, JUnit/NUnit, Selenium, Cucumber. A strong understanding of SDLC processes.
